docs.summary: The Media Manager API contains functionality for working with folders and files in the Media Manager.

permissions.name: Manage Media Manager
permissions.description: Request permission to manage media in the Media Manager.

params.name: fileIds
params.doc: IDs of the files to move to the Media Manager's trash bin.

params.name: permanent
params.doc:
Whether the specified files are permanently deleted.
Default: `false`

docs.summary:
Deletes the specified files from the Media Manager.
The deleted files are moved to the Media Manager's trash bin (`TRASH-ROOT` folder) unless permanently deleted. To permanently delete files, pass the `permanent` parameter with the value `true`. Permanently deleting files isn't reversible, so make sure that these files aren't being used in a site or in any other way as the files will no longer be accessible. Note the following: * The specified files can be from different folders. * Moving multiple files at once is an asynchronous action, and may take time for the changes to appear in the Media Manager. * Attempting to delete files that are already in the trash bin doesn't result in an error. * If your site contains deleted media files, the deleted media files still appear on your site as the files are still in the Media Manager (in the trash bin). * You can use the [Bulk Restore Files From Trash Bin](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/media/media-manager/files/bulk-restore-files-from-trash-bin) endpoint to restore files from the Media Manager's trash bin.

permissions.name: Manage Media Manager
permissions.description: Request permission to manage media in the Media Manager.

params.name: folderIds
params.doc: IDs of the folders to move to the Media Manager's trash bin.

params.name: permanent
params.doc:
Whether the specified folders are permanently deleted.
Default: `false`

docs.summary:
Temporarily deletes the specified folders from the Media Manager.
The deleted folders are moved to the Media Manager's `trash-root` folder (trash bin) unless permanently deleted. To permanently delete folders, pass the `permanent` parameter with the value `true`. Permanently deleting folders isn't reversible, so make sure that the files in these folders aren't being used in a site or in any other way as the files will no longer be accessible. Note the following: * When a folder is deleted, the files in that folder are deleted. * The specified folders can be from different parent folders. * Moving multiple folders at once is an asynchronous action, and may take time for the changes to appear in the Media Manager. * Attempting to delete folders that are already in the trash bin doesn't result in an error. * If your site contains files from a deleted media folder, the files still appear on your site as the deleted folder is still in the Media Manager (in the trash bin). * You can use the [Bulk Restore Folders From Trash Bin](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/media/media-manager/folders/bulk-restore-folders-from-trash-bin) endpoint to restore folders from the Media Manager's trash bin.

permissions.name: Manage Media Manager
permissions.description: Request permission to manage media in the Media Manager.

params.name: importFileRequests
params.doc: Information about the files to import.

docs.summary:
Imports a bulk of files to the Media Manager using external urls.
Returns information about the imported files. Use the `parentFolderId` parameter to specify in which folder you want each file to be imported to. If no folder is specified, the file is imported to the `media-root` folder. To import files, you need to provide one of the following: 1. Pass each file's [MIME type](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types) in the `mimeType` parameter of the request. For example, 'image/png'. 2. Pass each file's name and extension. For example, 'my-image.png'. 3. If you don't know a file's extension or MIME type, pass its media type in the `mediaType` parameter of the request. For example, 'IMAGE'. Note that this option only works if the server hosting the media allows a 'HEAD' request. >**Note:** The `media` property isn't returned in the `files` response object.

operations.name: Bulk Restore Files From Trash Bin

permissions.name: Manage Media Manager
permissions.description: Request permission to manage media in the Media Manager.

params.name: fileIds
params.doc: IDs of the files to restore from the Media Manager's trash bin.

docs.summary: Restores the specified files from the Media Manager's trash bin, and moves them to their original locations in the Media Manager.

operations.name: Bulk Restore Folders From Trash Bin

permissions.name: Manage Media Manager
permissions.description: Request permission to manage media in the Media Manager.

params.name: folderIds
params.doc: IDs of the folders to restore from the Media Manager's trash bin.

docs.summary: Restores the specified folders from the Media Manager's trash bin, and moves them to their original locations in the Media Manager.

examples.title: Bulk restore deleted folders and their content

permissions.name: Manage Media Manager
permissions.description: Request permission to manage media in the Media Manager.

params.name: displayName
params.doc: Folder name that appears in the Media Manager.

params.name: parentFolderId
params.doc: ID of the folder's parent folder.

docs.summary:
Creates a new folder in the Media Manager.
Use the `parentFolderId` parameter to specify in which existing folder you want the new folder to be created. If no folder is specified, the new folder is created in the `media-root` folder.

permissions.name: Manage Media Manager
permissions.description: Request permission to manage media in the Media Manager.

params.name: fileId
params.doc: File ID.

params.name: downloadFileName
params.doc:
Temporary file name used to identify the file type. For example, a file named "myFile.jpeg" identifies as an "image/jpeg" file type.
**Note:** The name that appears in the Media Manager is taken from the `filename` query parameter in the upload request.

params.name: expirationInMinutes
params.doc:
The time that it takes in minutes for the download URL to expire.
Default: `600`.
Limit: `525600` (1 year).

params.name: expirationRedirectUrl
params.doc:
The redirect URL for when the temporary download URL with a token expires.
Default: A 403 Forbidden response page.

params.name: assetKeys
params.doc:
Keys for downloading different assets (format and quality) of a file. 
 Default: `src`, key representing the original file's format and quality.

docs.summary:
Generates one or more temporary URLs for downloading a specific file in the Media Manager.
 
 To download different assets of the file, use the `assetKeys` parameter which generates a download URL for each asset. 
 If no `assetKey` is specified, it defaults to `src`, which generates one download URL in the original file's format and quality.
   
 Use this endpoint to grant external clients access to a private media file. Use the `expirationInMinutes` parameter to set the URL expiration time, and the `expirationRedirectUrl` parameter to add a redirect url when the URL expires.

examples.title: Generate a URL for downloading a file
body:
curl -X POST \
  'https://www.wixapis.com/site-media/v1/files/4acbb8_7596aeebcf5c41eca01c0d99667ac967.mp3/generate-download-url' \
  -H 'Authorization: <AUTH>'
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data-binary '{
    "downloadFileName": "Gorillaz - Feel Good Inc.mp3",
    "expirationInMinutes": "60",
    "expirationRedirectUrl":"www.mysite.com/store",
    "assetKeys": ["320kbs.mp3"]
  }'

permissions.name: Manage Media Manager
permissions.description: Request permission to manage media in the Media Manager.

params.name: mimeType
params.doc: File mime type.

params.name: fileName
params.doc:
Temporary file name used to identify the file type. For example, a file named "myFile.jpeg" identifies as an "image/jpeg" file type.
**Note:** The name that appears in the Media Manager is taken from the `filename` query parameter in the upload request.

params.name: sizeInBytes
params.doc: File size in bytes.

params.name: parentFolderId
params.doc:
ID of the file's parent folder.
Default: `media-root`.

params.name: private
params.doc: Whether the link to the imported file is public or private. See `Private Files` in terminology.

params.name: labels
params.doc: Labels assigned to media files that describe and categorize them. Provided by the user, or generated by [Google Vision API](https://cloud.google.com/vision/docs/drag-and-drop) for images.

params.name: uploadProtocol
params.doc: The upload protocol to use for implementing the resumable upload.

docs.summary:
Generates a resumable upload URL to allow external clients to easily upload large files over 10MB to the Media Manager.
With the resumable upload URL, any interruptions in the upload process pauses the file upload, and resumes the file upload process after the interruption. The resumable upload URL is also helpful when network connection is poor. To learn how external clients can use the generated upload URL in the response to upload large files to the Media Manager, see the [Resumable Upload API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/media/media-manager/resumable-upload-api) article.

permissions.name: Manage Media Manager
permissions.description: Request permission to manage media in the Media Manager.

params.name: mimeType
params.doc: File mime type.

params.name: fileName
params.doc:
Temporary file name used to identify the file type. For example, a file named "myFile.jpeg" identifies as an "image/jpeg" file type.
**Note:** The name that appears in the Media Manager is taken from the `filename` query parameter in the upload request.

params.name: sizeInBytes
params.doc: File size in bytes.

params.name: parentFolderId
params.doc:
ID of the file's parent folder.
Default: `media-root`.

params.name: private
params.doc: Whether the link to the uploaded file is public or private. See `Private Files` in terminology.

params.name: labels
params.doc: Labels assigned to media files that describe and categorize them. Provided by the user, or generated by [Google Vision API](https://cloud.google.com/vision/docs/drag-and-drop) for images.

params.name: externalInfo
params.doc: A place to map an external entity to an uploaded file in the Wix Media Manager.

docs.summary:
Generates an upload URL to allow external clients to upload a file to the Media Manager.
To learn how external clients can use the generated upload URL in the response to upload a file to the Media Manager, see the [Upload API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/media/media-manager/upload-api) article. >**Note:** Any interruption in the upload process stops the file upload. For files larger than 10MB, or when network connection is poor, use the [Generate File Resumable Upload Url](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/media/media-manager/files/generate-file-resumable-upload-url) instead. With the resumable upload URL, any interruption in the upload process pauses the file upload, and resumes the file upload process after the interruption.

permissions.name: Manage Media Manager
permissions.description: Request permission to manage media in the Media Manager.

params.name: fileIds
params.doc: IDs of the files to download.

docs.summary:
Generates a URL for downloading a compressed file containing specific files in the Media Manager.
The compressed file can contain up to 1000 files.

examples.title: Generate a URL for downloading a zip file containing the specified files

permissions.name: Manage Media Manager
permissions.description: Request permission to manage media in the Media Manager.

params.name: folderId
params.doc: Folder ID.

docs.summary:
Generates a URL for downloading a compressed file containing a specific folder in the Media Manager.
The compressed file can contain sub-folders, and up to 1000 files.

examples.title: Generate a URL for downloading a zip file containing the specified folder's content

permissions.name: Read Media Manager
permissions.description: Request permission to read media in the Media Manager.

params.name: fileId
params.doc: File ID.

params.name: format
params.doc: Video stream format.

docs.summary:
Generates a URL for streaming a specific video file in the Media Manager.
To stream different assets of the file, use the `assetKeys` parameter which generates a video streaming URL for each asset. If no assetKey is specified, it defaults to `src`, which generates one video streaming URL in the original file's format and quality.

examples.title: Generate a URL for streaming a specific video file

permissions.name: Read Media Manager
permissions.description: Request permission to read media in the Media Manager.

permissions.name: Read Media Manager
permissions.description: Request permission to read media in the Media Manager.

params.name: folderId
params.doc: Folder ID.

docs.summary: Gets information from a specific folder in the Media Manager.

permissions.name: Manage Media Manager
permissions.description: Request permission to manage media in the Media Manager.

params.name: url
params.doc: Publicly accessible external file URL.

params.name: mediaType
params.doc: Media type of the file to import.

params.name: displayName
params.doc: File name that appears in the Media Manager.

params.name: parentFolderId
params.doc:
ID of the file's parent folder.
Default: `media-root`.

params.name: private
params.doc: Whether the link to the imported file is public or private.

params.name: labels
params.doc: Labels assigned to media files that describe and categorize them. Provided by the user, or generated by [Google Vision API](https://cloud.google.com/vision/docs/drag-and-drop) for images.

params.name: mimeType
params.doc: File mime type.

params.name: externalInfo
params.doc: A place to map an external entity to an imported file in the Wix Media Manager.

params.name: urlParams
params.doc: Optional parameters that should be sent with the external URL.

params.name: urlHeaders
params.doc: Optional headers that should be sent with the external URL.

docs.summary:
Imports a file to the Media Manager using an external url.
 
 Returns information about the imported file.
 Use the `parentFolderId` parameter to specify which folder you want the file to be imported to. 
 If no folder is specified, the file is imported to the `media-root` folder. 

 To import a file, you need to provide one of the following: 
 1. Pass the file's [MIME type](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types) in the `mimeType` parameter of the request.  For example, 'image/png'.
 2. Pass the file's name and extension. For example, 'my-image.png'. 
 3. If you don't know the file's extension or MIME type, pass its media type in the `mediaType` parameter of the request. For example, 'IMAGE'. Note that this option only works if the server hosting the media allows a 'HEAD' request.

 >**Note:** The `media` property isn't returned in the `files` response object.

examples.title: Import a file using an external URL

permissions.name: Read Media Manager
permissions.description: Request permission to read media in the Media Manager.

params.name: parentFolderId
params.doc:
ID of the file's parent folder.
Default: `media-root`.

params.name: mediaTypes
params.doc: File media type.

params.name: private
params.doc: Whether the link to the imported file is public or private.

params.name: sort.fieldName
params.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

params.name: sort.order
params.type: All APIs.Site Media - Media Manager Backend._wix_common_SortOrder
params.doc: Sort order.

params.name: paging.limit
params.doc: Number of items to load.

params.name: paging.cursor
params.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a list of files in the Media Manager's trash bin.
>**Note:** The Media Manager's trash bin (`TRASH-ROOT` folder) only contains temporarily deleted files, not permanently deleted files.

examples.title: List files in the Media Manager's trash bin
response:
{
  "files":   [
        {
      "id": "229acbb8_5af267716b0d449c8c706bfdbf51d9d0.mp3",
      "displayName": "01 - ES - Susanne Vega - Tom's Diner.mp3",
      "url": "https://music.wixstatic.com/mp3/229acbb8_5af267716b0d449c8c706bfdbf51d9d9.mp3",
      "parentFolderId": "trash-root",
      "hash": "24bbee7b0f95258fb72e6e672fdb9f75",
      "sizeInBytes": "5582258",
      "private": false,

docs.summary:
Retrieves a list of files in the Media Manager. 

 To retrieve a list of files within a specific folder in the Media Manager, pass the folder's ID in the `parentFolderId` parameter. If no folder is specified, the endpoint retrieves the list of files in the root folder of the Media Manager.

examples.title: List image files in a specific folder

extra.description: This example sorts by `updatedDate` in `DESC` order with a paging limit of 2.

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of folders in the Media Manager. To retrieve a list of folders within a specific folder in the Media Manager, pass the specific folder's ID in the `parentFolderId` parameter. If no folder is specified, the endpoint retrieves a list of folders within the root folder of the Media Manager.

permissions.name: Read Media Manager
permissions.description: Request permission to read media in the Media Manager.

params.name: search
params.doc:
Term to search for. Possible terms include the value of a file's `displayName`, `mimeType`, and `label`.
For example, if a file's label is cat, the search term is 'cat'.

params.name: rootFolder
params.doc:
A root folder in the media manager to search in.
Default: `MEDIA_ROOT`.

params.name: mediaTypes
params.doc: File media type.

params.name: private
params.doc: Whether the link to the imported file is public or private.

params.name: sort
params.type: All APIs.Site Media - Media Manager Backend._wix_common_Sorting
params.doc:
Field name and order to sort by. One of:
* `displayName` * `updatedDate` Default: `updatedDate` in `desc` order.

params.name: paging
params.doc: Cursor and paging information.

docs.summary:
Searches all folders in the Media Manager and returns a list of files that match the terms specified in the parameters.
If no parameters are specified, the endpoint returns all files in the `MEDIA_ROOT` folder.

examples.title: Search files

permissions.name: Read Media Manager
permissions.description: Request permission to read media in the Media Manager.

params.name: rootFolder
params.doc:
A root folder in the media manager to search in.
Default: `MEDIA_ROOT`.

params.name: sort
params.type: All APIs.Site Media - Media Manager Backend._wix_common_Sorting
params.doc:
Field name and order to sort by. One of:
* `displayName` * `updatedDate` Default: `updatedDate` in `desc` order.

params.name: paging
params.doc: Cursor and paging information.

params.name: search
params.doc:
Term to search for, such as the value of a folder's `displayName`.
For example, if a folder's `displayName` is 'my-videos-folder', the search term is 'my-videos-folder'.

docs.summary:
Searches the Media Manager and returns a list of folders that match the terms specified in the parameters.
If no parameters are specified, the endpoint returns all folders in the `MEDIA_ROOT` folder.

permissions.name: Manage Media Manager
permissions.description: Request permission to manage media in the Media Manager.

params.doc: ID of the file to update.

params.name: displayName
params.doc: File name that appears in the Media Manager.

params.name: parentFolderId
params.doc:
ID of the file's parent folder.
Default: `media-root`.

params.name: labels
params.doc: Labels assigned to media files that describe and categorize them. Provided by the user, or generated by [Google Vision API](https://cloud.google.com/vision/docs/drag-and-drop) for images.

docs.summary:
Updates a file.
__Deprecation Notice:__ This endpoint has been replaced with [Update File Descriptor](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/media/media-manager/files/update-file-descriptor) and will be removed on March 31, 2023.
You can use the `parentFolderId` parameter to move a file from its current folder to a different folder.

permissions.name: Manage Media Manager
permissions.description: Request permission to manage media in the Media Manager.

params.name: folder.id
params.doc: Folder ID. Generated when a folder is created in the Media Manager.

params.name: folder
params.doc: The folder to update.

docs.summary:
Updates a folder.
You can use the `parentFolderId` parameter to move a folder from its current parent folder to a different parent folder.
Triggered when a file is updated, including when a file is moved to a different folder.

Triggered when a file is deleted.
 
 If the `movedToTrash` property in the event object `true`, the file was moved to the Media Manager's trash bin. If the `movedToTrash` property in the event object is `false`, the file was permanently deleted.

Triggered when a file is ready to be used, after any post-upload processing.
 
 This event is also triggred when a file is restored from the Media Manager's trash bin.
Triggered when a file fails during essential post-upload processing.

Triggered when a folder is created. 

 This event is also triggred when a folder is restored from the Media Manager's trash bin.
Triggered when a folder is updated, including when a folder is moved to a different parent folder.

Triggered when a folder is deleted.

 If the `movedToTrash` property in the event object is `true`, the folder was moved to the Media Manager's trash bin. If the `movedToTrash` property in the event object is `false`, the folder was permanently deleted.

members.name: resolutions
members.doc: Available resolutions for the video, starting with the optimal resolution.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: assets
members.doc: Audio formats available for this file.

members.name: assetKey
members.doc:
Key for downloading a different asset (format and quality) of a file. 
 Default: `src`, key representing the original file's format and quality.

members.name: confidence
members.doc: The accuracy percentage of the face recognition. The likelihood that a face is detected.

members.name: x
members.doc: Top left x pixel coordinate of the face.

members.name: y
members.doc: Top left y pixel coordinate of the face.

members.name: faces
members.doc: Information about faces in the image. Use to crop images without cutting out faces.

members.name: previewImage
members.doc:
Information about the image preview.
 You can use this to display a preview for private images.

members.name: id
members.doc: File ID. Generated when a file is uploaded to the Media Manager.

members.name: displayName
members.doc: File name as it appears in the Media Manager.

members.name: parentFolderId
members.doc: ID of the file's parent folder.

members.name: sizeInBytes
members.doc: Size of the uploaded file in bytes.

members.name: private
members.doc: Whether the link to the uploaded file is public or private. Private links require a token.

members.name: operationStatus
members.doc:
Status of the file that was uploaded.
 * `FAILED`: The file failed to upload, for example, during media post processing.
 * `READY`: The file uploaded, finished all processing, and is ready for use.
 * `PENDING`: The file is processing and the URLs are not yet available. This response is returned when importing a file.

members.name: sourceUrl
members.doc: URL where the file was uploaded from.

members.name: labels
members.doc: Labels assigned to media files that describe and categorize them. Provided by the user, or generated by [Google Vision API](https://cloud.google.com/vision/docs/drag-and-drop) for images.

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the file was created.

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the file was updated.

members.name: siteId
members.doc: The Wix site ID where the media file is stored.

members.name: paths
members.doc: The set of field mask paths.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.type: All APIs.Site Media - Media Manager Backend._wix_common_SortOrder

members.doc: IDs of the files to download.

messages.name: _com_wix_media_site_media_v1_GenerateFilesDownloadUrlResponse
messages.displayName: Generate Files Download Url Response Object

members.doc: URL for downloading the compressed file containing the specified files in the Media Manager.

messages.name: _com_wix_media_site_media_v1_GenerateFileDownloadUrlRequest
messages.displayName: Generate File Download Url Request Object

members.name: downloadFileName
members.doc:
Temporary file name used to identify the file type. For example, a file named "myFile.jpeg" identifies as an "image/jpeg" file type.
**Note:** The name that appears in the Media Manager is taken from the `filename` query parameter in the upload request.

members.name: expirationInMinutes
members.doc:
The time that it takes in minutes for the download URL to expire.
Default: `600`.
Limit: `525600` (1 year).

members.name: expirationRedirectUrl
members.doc:
The redirect URL for when the temporary download URL with a token expires.
Default: A 403 Forbidden response page.

members.name: assetKeys
members.doc:
Keys for downloading different assets (format and quality) of a file. 
 Default: `src`, key representing the original file's format and quality.

Whether the specified files are permanently deleted.
Default: `false`

members.name: parentFolderId
members.doc:
ID of the file's parent folder.
Default: `media-root`.

members.name: private
members.doc: Whether the link to the imported file is public or private.

members.name: sort
members.type: All APIs.Site Media - Media Manager Backend._wix_common_Sorting
members.doc:
Field name and order to sort by. One of:
* `displayName` * `updatedDate` Default: `updatedDate` in `desc` order.

members.name: files
members.doc: List of files in the Media Manager's trash bin.

members.name: nextCursor
members.doc: The next cursor if it exists.

members.name: externalInfo
members.doc: External information passed in the file import or upload.

members.name: origin
members.doc: External information to pass in the [File Ready](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/media/media-manager/files/file-ready-domain-event) or [File Failed](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/media/media-manager/files/file-failed-domain-event) events.

members.name: externalIds
members.doc: External IDs to pass in the [File Ready](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/media/media-manager/files/file-ready-domain-event) or [File Failed](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/media/media-manager/files/file-failed-domain-event) events.

members.name: file
members.doc: File entity that is ready with full information

members.name: externalInfo
members.doc: External information passed in the file import or upload.

members.name: triggeredByUndelete
members.doc: The File was restored from the trash-bin

members.name: id
members.doc: Folder ID. Generated when a folder is created in the Media Manager.

members.name: displayName
members.doc: Folder name as it appears in the Media Manager.

members.name: parentFolderId
members.doc:
ID of the folder's parent folder.
Default: `media-root` folder.

members.name: displayName

members.name: folder

members.name: parentFolderId
members.doc:
ID of the folder's parent folder.
Default: `media-root` folder.

members.name: sort
members.type: All APIs.Site Media - Media Manager Backend._wix_common_Sorting
members.doc:
Field name and order to sort by. One of:
* `displayName` * `updatedDate` Default: `updatedDate` in `desc` order.

members.name: folders
members.doc: Information about the folders in the requested folder.

members.name: nextCursor
members.doc: The next cursor if it exists.

members.name: rootFolder
members.doc:
A root folder in the media manager to search in.
Default: `MEDIA_ROOT`.

members.name: sort
members.type: All APIs.Site Media - Media Manager Backend._wix_common_Sorting
members.doc:
Field name and order to sort by. One of:
* `displayName` * `updatedDate` Default: `updatedDate` in `desc` order.

members.name: search
members.doc:
Term to search for, such as the value of a folder's `displayName`.
For example, if a folder's `displayName` is 'my-videos-folder', the search term is 'my-videos-folder'.

members.name: folders
members.doc: Information about the folders in the requested folder.

members.name: nextCursor
members.doc: The next cursor if it exists.

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • FAILED - File upload or processing failed
  • READY - File is ready for consumption
  • PENDING - File is waiting for processing or currently being processed

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • IMAGE
  • VIDEO
  • AUDIO
  • DOCUMENT
  • VECTOR
  • ARCHIVE
  • MODEL3D

Possible values are:
  • OK
  • DELETED

Possible values are:
  • TUS - The upload protocol to use for implementing the resumable upload.

Possible values are:
  • MEDIA_ROOT - Root of all site media 'media-root'
  • TRASH_ROOT - Root of the trash system folder 'trash-root'
  • VISITOR_UPLOADS_ROOT - Root of all visitor uploads 'visitor-uploads'

Possible values are:
  • ASC
  • DESC

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • HLS
  • DASH

Possible values are:
  • OK
  • DELETED
